html:
Corrects to add link to Telegraph article on Heathrow Airport

April 28 (Reuters) - The following are the top stories on the business pages of British newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.



The Times

- Ryanair Holdings Plc RYA.I has promised to respond to any cut in air passenger duty by boosting its domestic capacity in Britain. https://bit.ly/3xxVNZA

- Britain's largest listed software business Aveva Group AVV.L said on Tuesday its chief executive Craig Hayman had decided to quit. https://bit.ly/3sVrN6k



The Guardian

- The steel magnate Sanjeev Gupta could be summoned in front of MPs after the parliamentary business committee launched a formal inquiry into Liberty Steel following the collapse of its largest lender, Greensill Capital. https://bit.ly/3t0YQWq

- British sports carmaker Lotus has unveiled plans to increase its output more than tenfold, in a boost to the UK's post-Brexit automotive sector that will lead to new electric models being built in Norfolk. https://bit.ly/32RMci7

The Telegraph

- French state-backed satellite company Eutelsat ETL.PA has allied itself with Britain against Elon Musk's SpaceX by taking a stake in the space internet company OneWeb. https://bit.ly/3nrcWPK

- British Airways owner IAG ICAG.L is considering legal action after Heathrow Airport was given permission to sting passengers for hundreds of millions of pounds to cover pandemic losses. https://bit.ly/3dViK0H


Sky News

- Private equity firm bd-capital will announce on Wednesday the acquisition of a large stake in Ascenti, which launched 25 years ago as a provider of rehabilitation services to motor accident victims. https://bit.ly/2PrxI5c



The Independent

- British supermarket Waitrose will expand its Deliveroo ROO.L service by 110 shops to 150 by the end of the summer, giving more customers access to rapid home delivery. https://bit.ly/3gI5VsD



(Compiled by Bengaluru newsroom)

(( globalnewsmonitoring@thomsonreuters.com ))

Keywords: BRITAIN-PRESS/BUSINESS (CORRECTED)
